questiontext.text:
Given the following set of functional dependencies on the attribute set \(\{ABCDE\}\):

For which functional dependency is a left reduction possible?

generalfeedback.text:
The following left sides can be reduced:

  1. No reduction possible
  2. No reduction possible
  3. No reduction possible
  4. No reduction possible

questiontext.text:
Given the following set of functional dependencies on the attribute set \(\{ABCDE\}\):

For which functional dependency is a left reduction possible?

generalfeedback.text:
The following left sides can be reduced:

  1. Attribute B can be removed from the left side, because \(\{ ADC \}^+ = \{ ADCBE \}\) and B \(\in \{ ADC \}^+\).
  2. No reduction possible
  3. Attribute B can be removed from the left side, because \(\{ DE \}^+ = \{ DECBA \}\) and B \(\in \{ DE \}^+\).
  4. No reduction possible

feedback.text: Attribute B can be removed from the left side, because \(\{ ADC \}^+ = \{ ADCBE \}\) and B \(\in \{ ADC \}^+\).
Attribute B can be removed from the left side, because \(\{ DE \}^+ = \{ DECBA \}\) and B \(\in \{ DE \}^+\).

questiontext.text: Given the following set of functional dependencies on the attribute set \(\{ABCDE\}\): For which functional dependency is a right reduction possible?

generalfeedback.text:
The following right sides can be reduced:

  1. No reduction possible
  2. Attribute B can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ BCAE \}^+ = \{ BCAE \}\) and B \(\in \{ BCAE \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing B from the right side of the \(( b )\) functional dependency.
  3. Attribute E can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ BDC \}^+ = \{ BDCEA \}\) and E \(\in \{ BDC \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing E from the right side of the \(( c )\) functional dependency.

feedback.text: Attribute B can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ BCAE \}^+ = \{ BCAE \}\) and B \(\in \{ BCAE \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing B from the right side of the \(( b )\) functional dependency.

Attribute E can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ BDC \}^+ = \{ BDCEA \}\) and E \(\in \{ BDC \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing E from the right side of the \(( c )\) functional dependency.

questiontext.text: Given the following set of functional dependencies on the attribute set \(\{ABCDE\}\): For which functional dependency is a right reduction possible?

generalfeedback.text:
The following right sides can be reduced:

  1. No reduction possible
  2. Attribute C can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ BDE \}^+ = \{ BDEAC \}\) and C \(\in \{ BDE \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing C from the right side of the \(( b )\) functional dependency.
  3. Attribute E can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ D \}^+ = \{ DABEC \}\) and E \(\in \{ D \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing E from the right side of the \(( c )\) functional dependency.
  4. Attribute B can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ EA \}^+ = \{ EADBC \}\) and B \(\in \{ EA \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing B from the right side of the \(( d )\) functional dependency.
  5. Attribute E can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ ABD \}^+ = \{ ABDEC \}\) and E \(\in \{ ABD \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing E from the right side of the \(( e )\) functional dependency.

feedback.text: Attribute C can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ BDE \}^+ = \{ BDEAC \}\) and C \(\in \{ BDE \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing C from the right side of the \(( b )\) functional dependency.

Attribute E can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ D \}^+ = \{ DABEC \}\) and E \(\in \{ D \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing E from the right side of the \(( c )\) functional dependency.

Attribute B can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ EA \}^+ = \{ EADBC \}\) and B \(\in \{ EA \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing B from the right side of the \(( d )\) functional dependency.

Attribute E can be removed from the right side, because \(\{ ABD \}^+ = \{ ABDEC \}\) and E \(\in \{ ABD \}^+\) with respect to all functional dependencies, but removing E from the right side of the \(( e )\) functional dependency.
